actualResults.title: Missing Critical Security Headers
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Discovered absence of X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy, HSTS, X-Content-Type-Options, and X-XSS-Protection headers. This is a legitimate configuration weakness that increases attack surface for client-side attacks including clickjacking and XSS exploitation.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure via Server Header
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Server header reveals Werkzeug/1.0.1 and Python/2.7.18 version information, enabling targeted attacks. This is legitimate information disclosure that aids attacker reconnaissance.

actualResults.title: Missing Rate Limiting Protection
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - No rate limiting mechanisms detected across endpoints. Testing confirmed 80 consecutive requests were all accepted without throttling, exposing the application to brute force attacks and DoS. This is a legitimate security gap.

actualResults.title: HTTP/1.0 Protocol Downgrade - Outdated Protocol Support
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Application responds with HTTP/1.0 instead of HTTP/1.1, indicating use of Werkzeug development server. While low severity, this is a legitimate configuration issue with security implications around missing modern security features.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure - Application Source Code Accessible from Filesystem
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Source code including secrets file paths (secret.txt) is readable from the filesystem. While not directly exploitable via HTTP, this represents legitimate information disclosure risk if an attacker gains system access through other vulnerabilities.

actualResults.title: Use of End-of-Life Software - Python 2.7.18
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Python 2.7.18 reached EOL on January 1, 2020 and has multiple unpatched CVEs including critical vulnerabilities. This is a legitimate vulnerable and outdated component issue exposing the application to known exploits.

actualResults.title: Use of End-of-Life Python 2.7.18 and Outdated Werkzeug 1.0.1
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Comprehensive analysis of vulnerable software stack including Werkzeug-specific CVEs (CVE-2022-29361, CVE-2023-25577, CVE-2023-23934) beyond just Python EOL. This is a legitimate finding identifying multiple known vulnerabilities in the technology stack that could enable RCE and other attacks.

actualResults.title: Flask Debug Mode Enabled in Production
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Source code explicitly enables debug mode with debug=True, which exposes verbose error messages, potential debugger console access, and increases RCE risk when combined with Werkzeug vulnerabilities. This is a legitimate security misconfiguration.

actualResults.title: Information Disclosure via Application Error - Undefined Function
actualResults.assessment: Valid security finding - Application calls undefined check_xss() function causing NameError exceptions that expose information in logs and break endpoint functionality. While this bug actually prevents XSS exploitation temporarily, the information disclosure and broken functionality represent legitimate security and quality issues.

matched.actualTitle: Regex Bypass Vulnerability in XSS Filter (Incomplete XSS due to Application Error)
matched.matchReason: Both findings identify the same XSS vulnerability in the /xss31 endpoint caused by the insufficient regex pattern r'<[a-yA-Y/]+' that can be bypassed using uppercase 'Z' tags or non-letter characters. The actual finding confirms the regex bypass methods described in the expected finding (using 'z', 'Z', or malformed tags). While the actual finding notes that current exploitation is prevented by an application bug (undefined check_xss function), the core vulnerability in the regex validation logic matches exactly. The finding references the same code sections, demonstrates the same bypass techniques, and identifies the same security flaw in the tag filtering mechanism.
